I'm a Japanese tourist.

I came on AirAsia via HIS.

When I returned to Japan, I was constantly told to check in at the machine, and even when I went to the machine, I was asked for my reservation number.
However, the document from HIS does not have a reservation number written on it.
Therefore, even if you go to the counter again and say, "You can't check in using the machine!", they just insist that you "check in using the machine."

So when I looked back at my HIS documents, I found a form that was difficult to understand and required me to show the staff in English that I couldn't check in using the machine.

However, even if I showed them my English, the staff was insistent that I check in using the machine.

After that, I managed to check in, but...

Please be careful if you are going to Kuala Lumpur on HIS AirAsia.
Mr. HIS, is this okay?
I feel sorry for the Japanese people who will be traveling in the future.

KLIA is an international airport that always feels like a poor budget airport that is falling apart. Ironically, it is overstaffed by an army of smiling greeters.

On Sunday, 22 June 2025, we saw water dispenser stations broken and unrepaired. "Free drinks" stations abandoned, unmanned.

The only smoking room in the airport is a filthy room covered in black soot: incredibly smelly, no ventilation systems, piles of ash, trash, and butts all over. Warning: Enter at your own risk.

The aerotrain was being repaired, and although bus services were provided, no signs were available to passengers on where it is. Bus services from the sub terminal to the main terminal were not easy to find.

Tragically, the contrast between KLIA and KLIA2 (the latter an actual budget terminal that's well designed, modern, clean, and efficient) has never been clearer.

If KLIA2 is a Budget airport, then KLIA should be called a "No Budget" Airport.

Extremely Disappointed ‚Äì Misleading Prices and Poor Service

I had a very disappointing experience at this caf√© in the Malaysian International Airport. The prices displayed on the product tags were already quite high, but when I went to pay, I was suddenly asked to pay more due to ‚Äúadditional taxes‚Äù that were not shown upfront. This kind of pricing is misleading and unfair, especially in an international airport where transparency should be standard.

To make matters worse, when I questioned the price difference, the staff refused to give me what I had selected unless I paid the extra hidden charges. I ended up leaving without my purchase.

Travelers deserve honesty, clear pricing, and respect‚Äînot surprises at the counter. I hope airport management takes this seriously and enforces proper pricing standards. I would not recommend this caf√© to anyone.

I was told to eat at their disgusting snack bars, even though there are plenty of small restaurants in Terminal 1. In short, avoid them. I still thank the woman who helped me without the approval of her colleagues because she understood my suffering related to my ankle and the adrenaline caused by the pain.

KLIA is so huge, the potential clinical coldness of the facility is cleverly softened with what appears to be an atrium of greenery.
The once state of the art facilities of this Airport is marred by the breakdown of the Aerotrain system that used to provide a world class service between the terminals.
The Aerotrain gates have been hidden behind dark but colourful hoarding. Opposite the hoarding are lines of waiting passengers queuing to enter the various B gates, together with their various hand carry items. With poor lighting due to the height of the dark colourd hoarding,  this creates a somewhat long dark narrow somber passage that arriving visitors to Malaysia must navigate to reach the escalators to the ground level and transfer bus terminal.
Any negative impressions arising from negotiating past the queuing passengers with unsettled infants and the ocassional unrestrained child darting into the crowd flow is further accentuated as one reaches the ground level and confronted by the multinational crowd chaos at the
Satellite Terminal bus transfer gate.
The airport employees manning the area do a great job in moving the crowd in arbitrary groups onto the waiting buses. Despite the apparent crowd chaos, these Malaysian employees at various informal "gates" manage to prevent a crowd surge and create controlled access on to the buses. These lowly front line employees are the true heroes in this situation and are living examples of the "Malaysia Boleh" can-do attitude.  It's such a pity senior Airport management doesn't display a similar level of commitment in getting the Aerotrain system fixed and creating a positive first impression for international arrivals to Malaysia.
A suggestion:How about putting water fountains at all gates post-security. What a joke of an airport this place is.

Hands down the most inefficient airport I‚Äôve had the displeasure of travelling to

1. Pointless arriving early because your gate isn‚Äôt available and you end up waiting on the tarmac without air conditioning. Not enough leeway between departing / arriving flights and no backup plan

2. You often arrive at the departures gate rather than arrivals and need to take a bus to arrivals / passport control, which is a waste of time. The new aerotrain has been out of action for over 2yrs with completion dates, unsurprisingly, being delayed several times.

3. If you haven‚Äôt already been severely frustrated by the first 2 points, wait till you arrive at passport control. Only 2 (max 3) of the booths are open and staff are slow, disinterested and have no desire to speed up the process, as though they revel in seeing their visitors suffer.

This has been an issue for years with numerous local articles about it but efficiency and an improvement mindset simply does not exist in certain parts of the world.

Someone who travelling to malaysia for the 1st time had to write this here .here are the most unfriendly rude ground staffs i have seen..the whole process was so confusing..staffs in thw customer care should work for the welfare of the customers..not to talk rude and show attitude.
Also such a big airport and no enough toilets..2 each 2each in some corners and everyone has to wait in a  big quee to go to toilet and that is really pathetic...in small small airports also theres big multiple toilets available so many can use at a time...so no one has to wait in a quee to use toilets...for the 1st time im seeing such a tragic airport..
Spent 1.15 hours on the immigration queue - Believe it or not OMG! Worst management ever. Literally nothing good to say for this place but OMG from me.
Very conjusted, not enough chairs on international departure.
Old, dirty and the service is terrible!
They work fast and they try to help you but to change airlines and pick up your luggage for the next flight takes at least 2 hours.

Toilet at domestic terminal/public is a bit digesting. International is good. The aircon is not fully on. Very stuffy inside the building. The lifts to different level needs to improve. Many ppl cut queues.

I've used it many times, and in 2025 I used klia2 and klia domestic.
The information I received said that I would have to walk a long way, but klia2 was not that far compared to Haneda. I did have to walk to klia.
Immigration is quick with the automated gates, but if it's crowded you may have to queue a bit.
The only way to get from klia2 to klia is by train, as the free bus takes a long time. However, the downside is that there are few trains.
The only way to get to the city is by Grab. If you're staying in a hotel near KL Sentral, you may be able to take the train. The train is infrequent and inconvenient. You can buy tickets quickly on Klook.
Boarding gate K4 not cool. Very warm and sweating

I was assaulted by a female airport passenger experience officer who attempted to physically restrain me without justification. When I demanded to file a police report, I was told I would have to go to Terminal 2‚Äîsomething my Australian emergency passport did not permit. Despite my repeated requests, the airport police refused to take my report and instead escorted me to the immigration department.

There, I was met by an aggressive and unprofessional immigration officer named Kamarudin. When I asked for his full name in writing, he refused and rudely pointed to his name badge, telling me to take a photo with my phone. The moment I did, he became enraged and began intimidating me‚Äîeven going so far as to take photos of me and my passport on his personal phone. This was a blatant violation of privacy and professional conduct.

**Malaysia‚Äôs airport authorities and immigration officers behaved in a disgusting, abusive, and unaccountable manner. Travelers beware: AVOID MALAYSIA at all costs!**

**Legal Analysis**
This conduct raises multiple violations under Malaysian law:

1. **Assault and Criminal Force (Penal Code Sections 350-352)**
The staff member's actions in grabbing my arms and physically restraining me without consent constitutes criminal force under Section 350. Case precedent (PP v. Mohd Anuar bin Abdullah [1994] 2 MLJ 261) confirms that any intentional use of force without lawful justification meets this threshold.

2. **Wrongful Confinement (Penal Code Section 340)**
The unlawful restriction of my movement within the clinic treatment room amounts to wrongful confinement. Malaysian jurisprudence establishes that detention without legal authority is punishable, particularly where no legitimate lien exists over the person.

3. **Official Misconduct**
The behavior of Immigration Officer Kamarudin in:
- Failing to properly address a criminal complaint
- Intimidating a complainant
- Improper use of personal devices to photograph sensitive documents
May constitute offenses under Malaysia's official misconduct provisions.

UPDATE: Malaysian Airport Management have promised a full investigation of this matter however no official response as of yet.

Be careful when check in / boarding once your gate is open. You cannot take water through security and there is NO WATER whilst waiting boarding, and NO TOILET facility. Absolutely unacceptable especially considering the climate.

Had a layover at this airport. Extremely impolite staff. Extremely rude. First time visiting Malayasia, that too for a layover and the behaviour of the staff doesn't want me to visit this country ever again
Long waiting time for the luggage. Arrival time 5min ,waiting luggage 45min
There are not enough toilets. There are often long queues in the men's restrooms!

First and Last Time!

It's my first time in Malaysia, traveling from Abu Dhabi. As a UAE resident, I take pride in the excellent regulations we have. However, I had a very disappointing experience at Kuala Lumpur Airport with a police officer named Azhar, who was checking baggage. He removed several of our items, including our shower gel, face wash, moisturizer, perfume, mouthwasher (almost finished the bottle)and even drinking water as well. My wife and I have never encountered such treatment at any airport before, and we were shocked to learn that these items are considered "non-carryable" on flights, the things cost more than 700 AED, very disappointed, and will never come again worst experience ever.

Flight number OD 231
To Cochin
Happened on 20-04-2025
Flight time - 22:20

I lined up to check in for my flight back to Japan more than three hours before, but I was hardly moving forward.
I looked at the counter and saw that there were several windows open, but it seemed like it took a long time for each group, and it also took a long time to check the weight of my luggage.
In the end, even though I arrived at the airport early, I waited in line for more than two hours before finally completing the boarding process.
It took too long.
I'm sure it's the airline that's taking so long, but I think they should give it a bit more thought and improve it.
From there I headed to check my baggage, but normally it's done in one go, so I wonder what's going on as they check it three times here.
I think they should do it more efficiently.

Worst airport I've ever been to!!!
Check-in/baggage drop took forever (despite online check-in) and there were also very long queues at the passport controls. So definitely plan plenty of time. We were there over 3 hours earlier, but in the end it was very close. There are few signs and information boards in the airport.

DANGER!!!
The absolute shame is the controls in front of the individual gates (no information about them beforehand). AFTER going through the duty free shop area, you will have to go through security checkpoints again and drink/throw away all of the liquids you purchased there. You even have to destroy the water you bought for the flight. In the area between security check and the plane there is no longer any possibility to buy drinks/food (nor any possibility to refill your empty bottle with water) or to go to the toilet. When I asked where I could get something to drink, all I got was an annoyed ‚ÄúBuy in Plane‚Äù.

For a city like Kuala Lumpur, this airport is an absolute disgrace.

The airport looks very fancy and all - at least Terminal 1. It is very unorganized though. We arrived extremely late from our first flight (thank you batik air) and only had 15-20min
to get our connecting flight. Normally airports would provide a shuttle services, picking you from a gate to bring you to your connecting flight in time. This was not the case here, we were only told the gate number of our connecting flight, which after running to for 10min, turned out to be the wrong gate. So instead we had to take the bus to another terminal, which obviously did not give us enough time to catch our flight, so we were stuck in KL for 1 night. Additionally it is ridiculous, that there is no smoking area in the entirety of terminal 1. So if you are stuck here for a while you have to go all the way to terminal 2, into one of the most disgusting smoking rooms I‚Äôve witnessed in my life (no ventilation at all, might as well just walk in and breath twice and you‚Äôve already passively smoked a carton of cigarettes). Really disappointing for such a modern (only t1) and large airport.

Service at gate G1 KLIA 1 Kuala Lumpur flight with Batik Air OD 352 KUL to SUB on 15 Sept 2025 at 17.25 by one of the female ground officers with short black brown hair (bob cut) shouted at me rudely when I asked for the part of my boarding pass that I would use for administrative purposes of business travel.

Very unaccomodative airport. There was a delay in our flight. Firstly as I was with my baby, i asked for a transfer from buggy vehicle, which i was clearly denied stating that the gate was nearby. Secondly, this is not at accomodative for too many people. Staff isnt courteous enough to enquire regarding the space atleast for priority customers like the ones with the baby or so. The most disappointing experiences i have had till now when comparing to all other airports.
The worst airport ever in this world. 4 hours for lining immigration.
How many years will it take to fix the broken monorail? An embarrassment, arrivals process - with mega queues and buses - is akin to arriving into an Indian provincial airport!!
Be sure to eat an egg tart before you leave the country~
Just bad service, take too long.
The immigration process is taking too long. While we are waiting, the immigration officers are joking among themselves.
Very slow service

Overall ok.

I don't know if I can't see it, but I'm at the Gate B4 domestic departure, and I can't find a rubbish bin to throw my trash. I see a few rubbish laying around, I assume they also can't find a rubbish bin. Please have this in all your gates, and all around the airport. People don't want to litter, but there's not enough rubbish bin around.
Like a maze...the place lacks eateries...lol.

Worst transit experience ever.
The lounge and gate areas are chilled to fridge temperature
You can‚Äôt even go to the bathroom, because they are either closed for cleaning (but no one is cleaning) or they are open, but guarded by a cleaner who will follow you to the toilet and will wait outside the door to clean up right after. I don‚Äôt know about others but to me this feels extremely uncomfortable.
Very few public seating areas (only near the center) and they are not lit and very dark.
Air has a strong kerosine smell to it.
Has security checks directly at the gate (at least for our flight). The quests there are looooooooong and they use older scanners (electronics need to be taken out, watches and belts need to be taken off, ‚Ä¶ ), which makes everyone take an incredibly long time to go through the screening.

Only good point we had was the piano they had set up, that anyone can play on.
Too slow to pass
I was surprised that there was no toilet paper. The directions were unhelpful.

I feel very bad, when I went through customs for the first time, they could have reminded me to leave things over 100ml of water if there was any. But the first time they didn't remind me, when I got to customs to board the plane, they deliberately kept my 3 bottles of body mix.
I forgot to send it, it was my fault, but they didn't let me go back to check in my luggage and confiscated it, kept it separately and didn't destroy it.
I felt like they deliberately wanted to take my things. I felt unhappy and no longer had sympathy.

It will be the last airport on Earth you‚Äôd ever want to fly to or from. The gate numbers change constantly, often right before the designated boarding time.

Before you board, you‚Äôre forced to toss your water with no option to refill, leaving you reliant on the airplane for hydration. The train link between the main terminal and the satellite has been out of service for years. The security line before the gate is a complete joke and a massive waste of time. It‚Äôs truly the most dreadful airport on Earth, and it pales in comparison to world-class airports like Changi or even Suvarnabhumi.

A terrible place. We flew here at night for the first time. Filling out the online form‚Äîwe didn't like either the number or the email address‚Äîtook half an hour. Even in the relatively empty airport, we had problems. The electronic barrier wouldn't let Russian passports through, for some unknown reason, so much so that even the staff didn't know how to help.
We ended up staying at a regular hotel where the staff were sleeping. Then we searched for a hotel right next to the airport. We ended up sleeping there for five hours out of the planned eight because checkout was at 10:00 AM.
We arrived back during the day. The staff offered to complete the electronic history check, but the check-in line was insane, an hour and a half long, and very few windows for migrants were open.

1. Airport (specially departure area) has limited food options/vendors, resulting in high prices of available food items compared to market.
2. Flights of Air Asia and Gatik Airlines (Malindo) intend delayed without timely inform8ng passengers resulting in un-necessary waiting time

The airport is constantly under construction, but it's easy to navigate, and the staff is helpful. However, the immigration counters are very meticulous, and it sometimes takes up to an hour to be admitted. Unfortunately, the digital arrival form, which must be completed prior to entry, doesn't speed up the process at the counters.
Complicated
The border guards have terrible attitudes.
Seem small with so many user...

This airport has the longest imigration ive ever experienced in my life after visiting almost 10 countries in the face of the earth. I have a flight at 21:00 pm; and close gate at 20:30 pm. And ive been in immigration line for almost 3 hours and i only moved a few meters ahead. And the officers is a jerk, i already handed my passport and he just took off and leave me hanging and never come back.
I hope the malaysian royal government would fix this problem

Compared to this airport, Incheon Airport is heaven. Kuala Lumpur Airport is extremely difficult for both departure and arrival. The flight departure and arrival information is not properly provided, immigration is slow, and not only do they cut in line, they do not visit the Putra Mosque, and if you dare ask the staff a question, they glare at you and ignore you. I feel like I am a prisoner, not a traveler. Immigration took 2 hours and 30 minutes. When leaving, some boarding gates do not have restrooms. If you are assigned to such a boarding gate, you will have to have your belongings inspected again every time you go to the restroom.

No information about the immigration QR code to be scanned -
Clean and big
But the counter outside for taxi are scammers they make people pay double according to how they look like - the hijabi lady doesn‚Äôt seem to respect the scarf on her head - behavior to be reported, controlled and monitored
The employees do basically nothing to help you. Super difficult to find the lounge. Inefficient as can be. Avoid this airport if possible.

I bought the sake from KIX Duty Free in Japan, and it remained sealed throughout the journey.

However, during transit in Malaysia, customs took my sake and confiscated it. I showed the receipt to prove it was a duty-free item and it is a sealed item, but they refused to accept my explanation.

This was my first time transiting in Malaysia, and I am not happy with the experience.

The customer service are horrible here. I know you guys don‚Äôt speak English because that‚Äôs not your first English but it‚Äôs so rude the way you guys talked to me. I wish I didn‚Äôt use Malaysia airline so I didn‚Äôt have to come here to transfer‚Ä¶.

rubbish
no service at all

The world's most complicated and stupidly built airport. Terminals 1 and 2 are operated by shuttle buses, but the way to get there is ridiculously complicated. I've traveled all over the world, but this is the first time I've seen an airport structure like this. There are no signs, and it's inconvenient.
Lousy rubbish airport. Airport train service, auto gate for boarding pass checking. Systems make all flows stuck. Maybe marine and system are not suitable for Malaysia.

T2 departures is very badly laid out and very cramped! I don't know why so many reviews say this airport is spacious..

There is a water fountain close to gate L14 (not marked on any map). Don't buy water from the extremely overpriced food stalls.
Very unprofessional officers at immigration, no consideration even if you travel with young kids,, my kids were crying after standing in immigration line for almost 2hrs..

If I could rate zero stars I would, the toilet facilities we‚Äôre disgusting and almost unusable, in general the entire place was hot and disgustingly dirty and that‚Äôs just the physical appearance of the place, the attitude of all staff we came across was abhorrent; they were ALL rude and disrespectful, we just came from 3 weeks in Japan so we were absolutely respectful in every way and whenever we asked for help we were aggressively interrupted and given foul looks by everyone we encountered - the worst airport ever! Hoping to never have to go through there again, that will be my mission from now on whenever we travel, avoid this airport if at all possible!

It ok but the a huge issue I saw we fly from Kuala Lumpur to Manila.  At the ticket counter there were only (4) points to check in your baggage. We waited close to 30 mins. Then you went through an immigration security check point.  You waited another 20 mins.

Then you were bused to an other building then you walked to the gate.  At the gate you went through another security checkpoint, where I had to drank my water I just purchased, removed my watch.  After this checkpoint I just wanted to charge my phone for the Grab ride back to the condo, could not bring water on the plane.

No restroom in that area after the checkpoint.

Very annoying!

There Airport look clean good Wi-Fi we found a place to eat on the way to the gate.  It‚Äôs seemed like there could be improvement on immigration they did have a full staff and the wait was to long.
unclear labeling

Worst immigration experience in international airports compared to other major transit airports in Asia i.e  Dubai, Doha, Istanbul and Bangkok airports.

Immigration in the country took more than 1.5 hours and system was down so they had to do manual entries.

On the way back. Immigration took more than 2 hours. I had to request few people to let go of their turn so that I don't miss my flight. Only one counter for a queue of about 50 people(Normally takes 30 mins at other airports, however, the Malaysia made sure 50 people took 2 hours). There was this lady at the counter. She took more than 30 mins on one couple! FGS either accept or reject. Very un progressional behavior by the immigration staff.

This long wait made me miss my visit to chocolate shops as only 20 mins were left after the immigration clears. Moreover, for international departures you have to take a bus to another lounge. Which is weird for such a developed country.

The shops inside are nice and many food options are available.

Mosque is available on 3rd level. Have to search for it or ask for directions from the staff.

If some one wishes to connect a domestic flight directly with the international keep at least 3 hours buffer. Always book within the same literary.

Keep at least 2 hours for the immigration clearance. Such a pathetic and slow service. Even countries such as Pakistan and KSA have better immigration services.

The flight was ready to depart after boarding and other checks have been completed. However, it took more than 10 minutes for our plane to get permission to get on the runway.

Malaysia wants to attract tourists ? Please invest in your airport and immigration services. Thank you

T2 is the WORST airport imaginable. Immigration staff are overtly rude and unhelpful. Malay staff powertrip and yell at individuals for now reason. Insufficient toilets so even the mens room has a long queue. Chaotic with poor processes and staff who don‚Äôt not what to do. This country is not going to be a superpower any time soon and we certainly won‚Äôt be back to visit

KLIA is an international airport that always feels like a poor budget airport that is falling apart. Ironically, it is overstaffed by an army of smiling greeters.

On Sunday, 22 June 2025, we saw water dispenser stations broken and unrepaired. "Free drinks" stations abandoned, unmanned.

The only smoking room in the airport is a filthy room covered in black soot: incredibly smelly, no ventilation systems, piles of ash, trash, and butts all over. Warning: Enter at your own risk.

The aerotrain was being repaired, and although bus services were provided, no signs were available to passengers on where it is. Bus services from the sub terminal to the main terminal were not easy to find.

Tragically, the contrast between KLIA and KLIA2 (the latter an actual budget terminal that's well designed, modern, clean, and efficient) has never been clearer.

If KLIA2 is a Budget airport, then KLIA should be called a "No Budget" Airport.
The check in staff is quite rude and my plane was delayed to the improper management

No smoking room, late
The emigration zone for arrivals is very slow! The departure area is full of rubbish and leftover food everywhere!
KLIA 1 : Poorly maintained. Washrooms not clean. Already very few number of charging ports, out of which half are non functional. Insufficient seating on G gates.

Large and busy airport where it took us a long time to get through immigration even though we had already filled out the arrival form online.

I arrived at the airport two hours early, yet the airport's check-in arrangements and the efficiency of customs and immigration procedures have caused a delay. So should we be held responsible for this? Where does the responsibility lie?
Be careful of individuals claiming to be from China asking you for help with excuses such as losing their money, or not enough money to take the taxi, etc. What a scam. This is 2025.
Got to be the worst airport  for transfers to the satellite terminals. How it can three or more years to replace a train service. Staff at checkin and duty free were miserable today too!

The whole experience was not very good, the first thing we need to know is there is no drinking water   facility available , only 4 to 5 dispenser are there having a notice board the failure in working so it is advisable to always take water with you in the departures gate. During morning and evening there is so much of rush that you can't find a seat for yourself to sit for your boarding. It is very much congested and very poorly designed for public convenience. You have to be in line to use the toilet  which is there only 2 toilet blocks which we found in the departure area designated as L.

No information about the immigration QR code to be scanned - had to queue get rejected and then go back to scan the QR Code
Also the luggage belt was never displayed on the screen made us loose 30 minutes waiting
Clean and big space
But the counter outside for taxi are scammers they make people pay double according to how they look like - the hijabi lady doesn‚Äôt seem to respect the scarf on her head - behavior to be reported, controlled and monitored

The customer service are horrible here. I know you guys don‚Äôt speak English because that‚Äôs not your first English but it‚Äôs so rude the way you guys talked to me. I have got a bad experience with this airport and Malaysia airline. Hi, I‚Äôd like to complain about the experience today with Malaysia Airlines. I was so angry at the flight attendant so here is the complaint I sent to the Malaysia Airlines.

I took the airplane from Malaysia to Auckland on July 8th. I have been getting bad service even I was at the airport in Malaysia. People who work here are so rude and they don‚Äôt know how they talk with customers. I was on the airplane, there was no toilet paper in two bathrooms so I went to the back to use another bathroom. I didn‚Äôt know where it was so I was looking for it and a flight attendant who named Rasher or something was being rude to me. I asked a man flight attendant what her name is. He was nine at least. So what happened is that when I was looking for the bathroom, she goes the bathroom is here with a disgusted look while she was on the phone even I didn‚Äôt ask her anything. I was just looking. So I let her know there is no toilet paper in two bathrooms that I went to because she started talking to me even she was on the phone so I said to her nicely. And She said it‚Äôs in the middle. I felt she was trying to find some excuse to make her self look better in the situation. I could see that she doesn‚Äôt feel sorry she was doing that because there was a manager next to her so I said I don‚Äôt need apology from you because you already made me comfortable and it‚Äôs too late to apologise. Flight at 705am, we were ask to cross the checkpoint into immigration by 605am. We were 5 mins late, denied enterence, got ping pong around different department for 30mins. Ultimately it was the information counter that seems to know what to do, got into contact with the airline, but it was too late because of the time wasted by the ground crew that doesn't seems to know where to direct us.

Airline ground crew are locals, seemed oblivious and gave us the not my problem attitude.

Later we went to the airline office to check on how to retrieve our baggage, the staff's attitude was so poor with all the lecturing when we had been running around for 45mins and are in distress. Yes it was our fault for being 5mins late, she could had shown some empathy in her choice if words even though there's nothing she could had done.

That's the reality of Malaysian hospitality. 1st class on the surface, 3rd world attitude and mentality. I've seem way more polite and helpful staff in China and Singapore.

Compared to this airport, Incheon Airport is heaven. Kuala Lumpur Airport is a real pain in the ass for both departure and arrival. They don‚Äôt even properly announce the arrival and departure of flights, immigration is slow, and not only is there queueing, but there are also long lines and no one knows which line is right. If you dare ask the staff a question, they just glare at you and ignore you. I feel like a prisoner, not a traveler. Immigration took 2 hours and 30 minutes. When departing, some boarding gates don‚Äôt have restrooms. If you are assigned to such a gate, you have to go through a security check every time you go to the restroom. Delays of one hour are common, and I guess that‚Äôs because the flight control treats us passengers like that.
Wodrr why the monorail was not working?

Automatic passport gates are extremely laggy. You have to ride bus numerous times to get anywhere. Everything takes ages. Every single airport in the world has the security check before shops except for this one.

Avoid transfers here at all costs.
Been here many times. Horrible immigration processing. Will be dozens of people in line and only 1 officer per lane. Expect long wait times. Aim to arrive 3-4 hours before a departure
The airport is very small, everything is next to each other

Get more officers at the immigration counters you incompetent. You have 38 counters and just about 10 staffs with 2 hours+ queue and about 600 people? How did I know? I had all the time to count them and not enough time to get to the gate!

It's the capital airport of a big country „Ö†
It's hot because they turned on the air conditioner.
The bathroom is dirty because it's a toilet like a regular restaurant bathroom~
There's only one smoking room before the baggage checkpoint, but there's no signage. On top of that, it's not cleaned and it's very dirty
Despite being a large airport with a lot of transfers, there aren't enough chairs to rest and wait, and there are only paid massage chairs! And there's a lot of shopping. Malaysia is a beggar who's become rich~
Of course, the price is expensive, and even that's almost nonexistent after security.
Smokers, you must stop by the smoking room before security. If you go all the way to the corner before the P and Q gates, you'll find the smoking room.
After security, it's crowded with people waiting~ It's hard to find a chair~ The structure and area are very stuffy, and it's hard to find any amenities.

This is the worst experience. It's not even worth one star!
Extremely large and confusing. It took me an hour to get from Terminal 2 to Terminal 1. It's better to arrive a little early, or things might get tight if something goes wrong.
Unreasonably slow immigration service
Malaysia airlines came out with stupid baggage dropp off.it was so much time. Machine doesn't function properly.  I found it very inconvenient.

I suspect that there is organised crime gang operating out of KLIA and KLIA2 which specialised in pilfering customer luggage and stealing items while we poor passenger waited and waited for our luggage to arrive at the conveyor belt. The Air Asia luggage personnel also minimised the event as "Property Irregularity Report" even though it is clear as day that someone forcibly opened our luggage with a sharp object, probably a screwdriver. Air Asia staff claimed that out luggage was damaged from "rough handling" - NONSENSE! I think they are part of a criminal group stealing passenger belonging and minimising our complaints. SEE FOR YOURSELF if the pictures here show just rough handling versus CRIMINALS FORCIBLY OPENING OUR LUGGAGE. Highly suspicious for CRIMINAL GANGS AT WORK KLIA/KLIA2.

Generally okay but I had trouble getting drinking üö∞. It's supposed to be available per international regulations but I could only find one working machine after asking several staff took about 10 minutes looking around on another level

Crappy airport... T2 is very inefficient with check-in and onhboarding process that's supposed to be automated!
T2 is also poorly designed in terms of people movement flow and has very narrow corridors to the gates. Also very poor acoustics and natural light infiltration.
2 hours queing to pass the imigration.

Was about to miss our flight, our flight was supposed to be in gate L but our boarding pass said it was gate P, when we heard the announcer saying "last call", we didn't know where our gate was supposed to be since it was our first time in Malaysia and we didn't think about reading or seeing any of the screens because we didn't think the gate would change so abruptly and so far away, we asked the staff there and they weren't much help, it was like they DIDNT CARE if we missed our flight. They kept leading us around in circles, and we ended up missing our flight to Singapore. Thankfully, they rescheduled our flight to the next day and gave us a free night at a hotel. Service is 0/10, but the rest is quite decent.

I‚Äôve been using KLIA for many years, and I‚Äôm surprised that even today, there are still no automated bag drop facilities. As a result, the check-in process can be quite slow‚Äîeven if you‚Äôve already done web check-in. I arrived at 6:30 AM for a 9:30 AM flight and still had to queue for almost an hour just to drop my bag. If you‚Äôre flying internationally, I strongly recommend arriving at least 3 hours before departure.
Very crowded and unorganized

2019 International departure, water dispensers malfunction. Passenger bridge no aircon under 2pm hot weather ! Poor management.
2025 whole domestic B adapter slot not working!

As a frequent flyer across nations, this airport has to be the worst one. It all started with the spread out layout of the check in kiosks and then the queuing of air Asia baggage check ins then the queuing to weigh bags and several sets of security checks. It‚Äôs ridiculous. Also lack of baggage staff for air Asia is so disappointing. When you get into
the airport trying to find your gate, they‚Äôre in jumbled order- L3 is not next to L2 and so on. The waiting areas before boarding are also not it. Sorry KL I‚Äôm not coming back because of how poorly layed out this airport is.
The way they manage arrival is messy and so slow

I had the worst experience in this airport for travelling.  This looks fancy but very old school.
Restaurant not enough air con at night time. Sweating when eating

Very confusing direction or procedure given.
I was required to transferred here from overseas to KKIA (domestic) i was not required to take my lugguage while I gone through the customs here. Then walked all the way from international to domestic from the international building. But then I was required to "enter" the Malaysia border again while I was in KKIA (I took domestic) with my checked in luggage and scanning my index fingers
When i went back from KK to KL, I only required to go thru the custom once at KKIA. I was expecting to go thru the domestic building so I can get some local products.
Then my hand luggage was required to go thru x ray just at the gate when leaving from KL to overseas. My flask was full of water. But it was not required to empty out. And no airline staff at the gate just b4 boarding to check the boarding priority.
Airline still tier off the ticket manually.

As I thought I can walk thru, so I followed the sign. I realised I couldn't walk thru after 5 mins later. Then I walked back and realised the sign was directed incorrectly neat gate G section. One pointing left and the other sign pointed right. I saw few customers including aircrew staff were confused and didn't know which way to go.

Further, the staff was staring at me while was brusing teeth at the washroom at 6am. I realised she's waiting to clean my spot after I finished brushing. She either come back rather than just staring at me. I felt so unconfmy and I was the only passenger there.

I went other less modern airport like ho chi Ming city or in Istanbul. Where still have better experience than in Malaysia
Everything were great except immigration office long line waiting, you have to finde solution for this issue
Navigating around can be a little challenging and there are no free shuttle between KLIA1 and KLIA2 for the early birds.
Most of the local public toilet floors are wet.

Unfortunately, it's not good and the behavior of one of the passport office employees is very bad. She reprimands and tells you not to bring your wife or travel with her anywhere because of her clothing (abaya and modesty, thank God). Even her colleague criticized her and apologized for her unprofessional behavior that is contrary to the teachings of our Islamic Sharia. This is my first time going to Malaysia and thank God I got out of it and I will never return there again, God willing...
Eat something, 881 Kuala Lumpur.

Poor signage means that navigating around the airport is difficult.  The layout is also poorly designed because the security is at each gate, meaning that you're not allowed to take any water onto your flight.  You also don't know roughly how long it will take to get from the main terminal to the gate

If you come early (in my case, 2 hrs before departure,) you can't go to your gate. You have to wait in the hall. I went to the gate and got told to leave because it's not time for my flight yet. Now I have to go through gate security again when it's time for my flight.

Immigration customs was incredibly slow, proving we'd indeed arrived in Southeast Asia. This slow-moving customs officer spent nearly five minutes probing each passenger. He was a bit arrogant, quite annoying!

Beautiful airport but everything is far apart and directional signage is not clear. Sarcastic immigration officer. I accidentally left my small bag at one of the many security checks (3 security checks with Xrays after arrival?? Why??) and the security guard meters away was not helpful at all. Sarcastic immigration staff. I will avoid using this airport again.
No air cond I really don't know why....
Very very bad imigration
The dumbest setup I've ever seen, everything is very confusing, it's like a shopping mall where you can do everything except calmly find your way and board a plane.

After checking in, I got a pink card, which required me to go through security at the boarding gate one hour before departure. I was so anxious that I realized I didn't need to go an hour early. There was no toilet or water dispenser in the waiting room. In addition, the entry and exit routes overlapped, and the signs were not clear. If you are in a hurry, you will be frustrated to find the way. The difficulty level is probably hellish on a scale of 1-10.
No smoking room, not good, late time

Note
-Because there is one more baggage check before boarding the plane when leaving,
You have to go early to check the time!!

@It's small, but everything is there,
Departure hall on the 5th floor
Arrival hall on the 3rd floor
High-speed train on the 1st floor.
I think there was a food court on the 2nd floor (Starbucks too)

There are also various chains such as Kyochon, Taco Bell, and Din Tai Fung on the 5th floor.

+Beryl's Chocolate? Palm here too.

+Alcohol prices are expensive. It's more expensive than duty-free shops in Korea, and it seems similar to or slightly cheaper than the market price in Korea.. There's no reason to buy.

+There are 4Fingers, McDonald's, and Burger King.

+If you keep getting the wrong password when withdrawing money from an ATM, your card will be retained and it will be very difficult to get it back.
You can get scammed, so bring 2 cards and be careful.
Transit is a bit confusing. Otherwise great airport

Nice looking airport but it needs more power outlets so I can charge my phone. I‚Äôve been walking around for an hour now and the few that you have installed are all taken. Please add more. My phone is on 13% as I write this review.

Drinking water is a major issue at the airport and there are several reviews mentioning this but nothing has changed. You are not allowed to take your water beyond security which is understandable but how can you not have water filling stations or even bottled water for people waiting to board? It's quite disappointing and shocking, and can be a big issue especially for elderly passengers and those with health issues. In a hot and humid climate, access to drinking water is essential. Unfortunately, there are no water refill stations or bottled water available after security.

If there is a flight delay, passengers are left waiting for hours without water. I've been to several airports and never had this issue, just look at Singapore airport where there are water refill facilities everywhere.

I strongly urge the airport authorities to look into this and provide better facilities for water access after security. The current conditions are simply unacceptable especially for the elderly and those with health issues.
The Que to pass my Customs inspection on arrival easily take 30mins and above. To make the situation worst, The Que is not organise at all, everyone just cut in here and there

Overcrowded airport, 1 hour wait on the immigration. Then 30 minutes wait on bag carousel because not enough bag carousel. It‚Äôs been over 20 years no expand has been made. Even Singapore have 5 terminals with 5 times less population than Malaysia
Everytime you have to travel through klia 1, and you realize the train is still broken, it will suck the soul out of you. The reallllllly long walks to get to the bus at 2am gosh. The worst.
The immigration service is an absolute joke, some of the officers just took off without replacement during rush hour despite extremely long queues.

I had one of the worst airport experiences at Kuala Lumpur International Airport, Terminal 2. Upon arrival, we were met with confusing procedures and zero proper guidance on how to complete the entry process. The ‚ÄúArrive‚Äù app they require is completely unnecessary, buggy, and slows everything down. There was no one clearly assigned to assist passengers, and the process made no sense.

To make matters worse, we approached a uniformed police officer for help, who rudely dismissed us and refused to offer any kind of support. His tone was aggressive, unprofessional, and completely inappropriate for someone representing airport security. Instead of helping travelers‚Äîmany of whom were clearly confused and exhausted‚Äîhe seemed more interested in scolding people.

The lack of signage, the useless app, and untrained or unwilling staff made the whole arrival process feel hostile and disorganized. For a country that depends on tourism, this kind of treatment is unacceptable.

I won‚Äôt be flying into KLIA Terminal 2 again anytime soon.

The service was inefficient. I arrived at the airport three hours early and used up all my time waiting in line, yet so many people still cut in line. The staff noticed (and other passengers complained) but didn't do anything about it.

Garbage

You want me to rate this airport for real?
Omg i am so disappointed. Staffs are working so hard but unfortunately the system is boring tired. This scanning system you need to come at airport 5 hours prior to flight.
The airport saving a lot of people masha allah. But with this system you can stand on line for boarding and flight leave. That not accounting about purchasing extra baggage killos. üò¢üò¢üò¢

Saw an unattended Luggage in Concourse C while entering the Burger King. After I left BK the luggage was still there. So I went down to inform Airport staff. There were 3 guys staring at their phones. I told them about the luggage but they didn't care at all, just saying that the person  probably eating at Burger King. Yes sure, the luggage was about 10meters away from the Entrance. So Airport staff don't care for safety concerns

Immigration is really bad. Long queuing for more than 2 hours, even only for departure, exiting the country. Only 2 or 3 counters were open. A lot of other customers complaints and missed the flight. No sense of urgency, no empathy. Very bad management.

After checking in, I got a pink card, which required me to go through security at the boarding gate one hour before departure. I was so anxious that I realized I didn't need to go an hour early. There was no toilet or water dispenser in the waiting room. In addition, the entry and exit routes overlapped, and the signs were not clear. If you are in a hurry, you will be frustrated to find the way. The difficulty level is probably hellish on a scale of 1-10.

Why is KLIA becoming more unreasonable now..??

Why is it necessary to remove the existing chairs..??

Is it because you're afraid that homeless people will sit there..??

What about the disabled,the elderly and other people who are tired and want to sit down..??

Is it necessary to waste time and energy going all the way to that very far away observation tower..??

We have the right to sit in those chairs,
immediately place the chairs in all the places they should be placed..

That day my father had to sit on the floor only because the 6 seats for senior citizens were full even though my father is elderly..

Where is your humanity..??

The airport is highly inefficient, with passengers piling up at immigration where only two windows were open. We waited over two hours just to get through. When the airport process takes even longer than your flight, it‚Äôs definitely not a good experience.

1. Many tourists seems dissapointed with electric point not working. i simply saw MANY OF THEM. Lets tell them, "Welcome to Cave".
2. Only one household water filter serviceable for entire 10 gates or 1000 passengers per day. I was left thirsty for 2 hours for letting other peoples to take water. It shows "low water" everytime a person refills. Coway is for house damit, not for international airport!

Horrible experience. The gates are placed in a very inconvenient manner. Narrow hallways. Not suiting to such a major hub. The security check is very ill placed and ill maintained. No proper trays. My female co passenger was checked by a male staff.
If the flights are slightly delayed forget making it because the gates are in other universes.
No smooth connectivity or ease of use.

After renovation, this airport looks worst, look at the ceiling and tight places, people can‚Äôt cross properly and the ceiling add ons are just pure ugly, looks like you‚Äôre in a construction tunnel not an airport, it was nicer before renovation, and the train services to arrival are not available for public uses anymore but exclusive to business class only, so people now have to take buses to the arrival hall, it‚Äôs such a big downgrade, someone need to fire the person who designs and organised KLIA and hire someone new with vision

We bought water at the airport. Right at the gate, they checked again, and we weren't allowed to take the bottle with us unless we put it in a ziplock bag. No problem, we had one with us, but it was only allowed in an official airport bag, which we were supposedly given at the shop. So we went back and wanted to get one, but of course the shop didn't have any. When we asked at other shops, we were rudely turned away. Very strange; I hadn't heard of that before.

"My wife has been to many airports and passed through numerous customs checks! But this airport has the most idiotic and ridiculously behaved customs officers I've ever seen. I remember one of them, named Jeffrey, who asked my wife the most absurd and nonsensical questions. I had been warned beforehand that Malaysian customs might be difficult for women due to religious or sensitive reasons. However, I was traveling with a group tour booked by my company, with a guide who accompanied us throughout. So, what did he want? A bribe? The trip was terrible due to the unpleasant experience with the Malaysian customs officers, but everything else was fine."

I love Malaysia, but the experience with the immigration officers at KLIA1 was very disappointing. The immigration staff were unnecessarily rude both on arrival and departure. It left a bad impression and needs urgent improvement. Malaysia is a beautiful country, and I sincerely hope this can be addressed to make the entry and exit experience more welcoming.
Airport link has not reopened yet

One of the worst in handling passengers. The concept of having security check in the enterance of gate is a biggest mistake. Only one scanner for more than 200 passengers, very less staffs. No proper water facility inside the airport. Most of the water dispensers were not in working conditions nor giving low water alarm. Security checkin is close to the gate, they don't allow water bottle inside. In the gate waiting area no facility for water. If the flight gets delayed everyone need to wait for a cup of water till get boarded.

Not a fan of this airport. There were very few and separated charging ports throughout the facility and limited and spread out sitting for gates, at least until the 5 minutes before boarding where it opened into an ample space. The airport was warm and humid, but clearly just poorly air conditioned. All the facilities were clustered near the center of the terminal, mostly duty free stuff. Only one up scale restaurant and a Dunkin Donuts. I hope to not have to come through here again.

KLIA2 is a long way from the plane to immigration.
Usually there is a buggy that likes to go back and forth.
Worst airport ever. They dont have water to buy in gate. Nobody tell us that. Also so unfriendly ...

Disgusting airport, not only is the gate system not thought out and when you change gates you have to re-check in, it's a 20 minute run. There are no announcements. All the water you buy after the test you end up throwing away. The staff goons are not helpful at all. Half of the signs are not clear and it is easy to get lost.
0 efficiency. Third world airport flow.

Horrible experience!!!  This is the worst airport I have been to. There is no seating area before immigration. The way the flight schedule is displayed is not user friendly. Announced in the terminal 2 building are inaudible, the flight schedule is so dispersed and no power outlets for chatting only USB type A. Airline kiosk staff is sassy . I missed my flight because of severe logistic issues. Had to stay is all night at the airport to catch h the next flight. No flights schedule displayed at  terminal H10 . It was like a ghost town. I never want to come here again. I was at the airport from 2:00pm and have to leave at 7:04 am just because of poor planning and communication.

It is NOT ONE OF THE BEST AIRPORTS. They don't have a bathroom once you go to the gate. And they don't even have enough chairs for people to sit waiting to go in the gate!! It's really dumb. People just sitting around on the floor ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Worst Airport.. Don't Have Basic Facilities like Drinking Water Dispenser or Water Cooler.. We Have to Pay & Take the water with a High Charge..

So many cockroaches in toilet...
Pest control totally failed

At night, most of the shops/eateries were closed. Also restrooms were closed for maintenance.
Went to 2-3 restrooms to find a working one.
Not such a great experience with night travel.

For tourist exit, immigration was super quick.
Security check was also quick, if you empty the things.

After security check no water or washrooms.
Terrible Wi-Fi in departure zone H, constantly drops out

This airport made me never want to come back to Malaysia. Who designed this place?!

First, the walk from the plane to immigration and baggage claim was unbelievably long. I‚Äôve traveled through many large airports, but I‚Äôve never had to walk this much just to reach my luggage. I could overlook that‚Ä¶ but what came next was even worse.

After collecting our bags and passing immigration, we were forced to walk through (GET THIS!) A MALL to get to the exit. Yes, a literal mall where every airport in the world you'd be checking your transportation to finally leave. After a long flight, the last thing anyone wants is to be dragged through a maze of stores just to leave the airport. It felt like a cash grab, not a travel hub.

We finally made it out and were relieved to see Grab was available (we‚Äôre used to it from Thailand). But when we booked a ride, the wait time was 35 minutes! There was a huge, overcrowded Grab waiting area with screens showing incoming car plates, clearly, demand was way beyond what the airport could handle.

Tired and frustrated, we gave up on Grab, hoping to catch a bus instead. But we weren‚Äôt allowed to buy tickets until exactly 12 AM, which was also the listed departure time of the bus, because it's too late now to buy tickets (15 minutes ahead). We were told the bus would leave even after 12. The whole thing felt disorganized and unclear and the wait time seemed same as the Grab and the destination station is not even close to the hotel.

In the end, we paid over double the Grab fare to take a regular taxi, just to get the hell out of there.

Oh and did I mention that the airport wifi is not available once you finish immigration? I had such a hard time to book the Grab and check information and chat with my airbnb host because there was no wifi after immigration, because there's a freakin' mall between the airport and the exits!!!

This airport is a logistical mess and a terrible first impression of Malaysia. I've never thought an airport would affect my will to visit a country but here we are.
All seats should have a charging port.

Be careful of the taxi dispatchers on the arrival floor of Terminal 2 who look like they have permission to drive because they have name tags hanging from their hands. The taxi fare to Kuala Lumpur was about 8,000 yen, which is about double the price. On the way back, I used Grab, but it was just under 3,000 yen.
Big airport and very crowded

RTS agents representing Air Asia really screwed us up in KLIA 2. We were sent on a wild goose chase to drop our bags to three different locations. At the end, the lady decided to close her counter arbitrarily after folks have been waiting in line for a long time. Her only reason ‚ÄúI want to get out of this counter!‚Äù. I begged her saying you are guest services, you have to help us! I had a flight that leaves in 40 mins. She begrudgingly helped me with attitude. Probably never coming back to Malaysia with these experiences.

Furthermore, departure for KLIA 2 had shopping malls and restaurants at its entrance. This made it difficult to get to our check in counter and to our gate ultimately. The poor design was absurd and contrary to airports worldwide, making it a frustrating experience for travellers.

To make things worse, I got food poisoning from the nasi kandar food court.
T1 Departure hall toilet closed after midnight. The remaining has a long queue. It shouldn't happened.
Something need to be done to the long immigration queue

Dear traveler, do NOT use "taxi" that waiting at the airport. They "offer" you a ride for rm300-400. You should only get a ride via ehailing service, I recommended BOLT. A ride from airport to Kuala Lumpur should not exceed RM80, MAX. If a 4 seats it RM50 MAX. If you book an ehailing, driver can't ask more money from you. Pay what in the app. If driver ask for more money, record them & car number plate, and go to police station to submit a report. Those driver who doesn't use the app / ask for more money is the betrayal to Malaysia.
7kg limit for carry on bag

One of the worst airports in the world. The airlines and the airport will not inform if they change boarding gate. They tell you fight delayed and so you wait at the gate. The boarding gate is changed but you are still waiting at the original boarding gate and nobody bothers to inform you that the boarding gate is changed. You continue to wait at the original boarding gate until the flight leaves from the changed boarding gate. Leaving you stranded.

Updated 28th Feb.
Last night I asked a police constable if the carparks is free and she looked at me shocked. I said I just drove in at the auto gate.

She said the system has taken a photo of you car number and will charge you accordingly.

O said

Arriving:
Immigration for arrivals took too long! The officers works so slowly and the poor internet connection in this area is not helping either. It took us long enough to complete immigration to the point that our bags were no longer in the conveyor belt/shown on screen. Pick up location of ride hailing (Grab) was easy at Level 1.

Departure:
Check in counters are spread out making it not too crowded/congested. Immigration for departure is quicker and easier. However, there's a security screening for customs departure that was separated with at-gate security check. I would say this is very inefficient as you need to check your bags twice and once you have cleared security you practically cannot go out to the retail area. This also lead to congestion during Gate Open as people would avoid coming to it and come as late as possible.

Security at the gate is so slow. In addition, the post-security gate is a nightmare with neither water stations nor proper toilet! There seems to be no signs of priority boarding based on group but rather by seats (not sure if this is an MH or KLIA problem). Retail space is decent with great tax-free goods options and decent restaurant selections. One thing to appreciate: the toilets (in retail & public) areas are clean and equipped with jet showers.
Large and busy airport where it took us a long time to get through immigration even though we had already filled out the arrival form online beforehand.

Fast security, however, they confiscate small scissors (cosmetics) even though I've always carried them with me, regardless of the country.
Air Asia is very strict about weight and checks if the suitcase exceeds 7 kg before going through security. Even if you checked in online, you'll still have to go through security.

This is probably the most complicated airport I have ever encountered. It was not very logical and easy to figure out, especially how to understand which terminal the flight was from if there was no information on the airport website. The picture was marred by two more flight delays for a total of 4.5 hours.
Really crowded airport at passport control.. waiting for an hour and a half to complete entry procedures

Immigration and exit are mixed together and it is very chaotic. To get off the plane and go to another immigration, you have to take a bus to connect. The tram seems to have been under maintenance for a long time and has not been repaired.

The pick-up and drop-off on the first and third floors outside are very chaotic. Grab needs to go to a special area on the first floor, and the airport pick-up arranged online is on the third floor. It is very chaotic.

I had an extremely frustrating experience with the immigration process at this airport. The service was painfully slow, with long queues that seemed to move at a snail‚Äôs pace despite there being multiple counters. It felt disorganized and inefficient from the moment I arrived.

What made it worse was the attitude of some of the immigration officers. Several of them appeared moody and unapproachable, offering no guidance or courtesy. Instead of helping travelers‚Äîmany of whom were confused or exhausted‚Äîthey seemed irritated and dismissive. I understand their job isn‚Äôt easy, but a basic level of respect and professionalism should still be expected.

This kind of experience leaves a very poor impression, especially for international visitors. I hope the airport authorities seriously look into improving the staffing, training, and overall management of the immigration area. Travelers deserve better.
Klia1 is a complete nightmare. Confusing or misleading signage. Not clear taxi pickup points. Klia2 is a gem compared to this.

Extremely Poor Accessibility & Lack of Compassion

I brought my elderly grandmother‚Äîwho requires a wheelchair and has dementia‚Äîto the airport, and the accessibility experience was appalling.

When I approached the front desk to request a wheelchair, I was told to go all the way to the check-in area at the end of the terminal first. How is someone supposed to leave a person with dementia alone while they go fetch a wheelchair? We had no choice but to walk the entire distance, which completely defeats the purpose of offering assistance in the first place.

To make matters worse, the check-in counter we needed was right at the end of the row. If my grandmother had truly been immobile, she would‚Äôve had no way to reach that point on her own. Imagine if she were a solo disabled traveller‚Äîwhat would have happened then?

Even more disappointing was the staff attitude. There were six front counter staff chatting among themselves, not a single smile, not a trace of compassion or initiative. It felt like basic empathy and responsibility were missing entirely. Accessibility should not be an afterthought, and neither should kindness.
Gate G10 does not have any water fountain or vending machines. We have to discard our water and after queueing up for more than 30 mins cannot access any water to drink.

9/22 it is too HOT inside!!!!
How can we have a good experience in Malaysia???

Unpleasant, huge and useless airport! Walking from the gate to the control is torture! Walking from the street to the check-in is torture! No cafe, no food! Nothing to do here!!! One of the most unpleasant international airports
Getting shouted by one of the janitor in the airport for changing baby nappy at baby changing boardü§¶please teach your janitor what this things for....

Most horrible airport experience till date. Even though we were in transit we had such an awful experience at the security check in. Such rude racist staffs favouring Caucasians and looking down on Indian passengers. Surprised to see this considering a significant part of their citizens have Indian ancestry. The whole experience made us appreciate the hospitality of Arab countries. My family had planned our next trip to Malaysia. Well never again are we going to set foot there again.

No information about the immigration QR code to be scanned - had to queue get rejected and then go back to scan the QR Code
Also the luggage belt was never displayed on the screen made us loose 30 minutes waiting

But the counter outside for taxi are scammers they make people pay double according to how they look like - the hijabi lady doesn‚Äôt seem to respect the scarf on her head - behavior to be reported, controlled and monitored
The gate speaker is too loud
Poorly indicated airport exit
Toilet Too few rooms

I had an unpleasant experience at this airport, in my opinion the x-ray officers need to improve their professionalism, I usually travel to various countries with a backpack filled with stuff that I usually bring, no one has ever had a problem, but when I entered the x-ray the officer named Fatehah was angry because there were too many small items in my bag, as long as they were items that were not prohibited, there should be no problem. If you ask for a re-scan, do it in a polite, elegant and professional manner. I am still disappointed with the service at this airport.

Worst airport to fly to‚Ä¶.
It‚Äôs been SEVERAAAAAL years since their internal train transit between gates and immigration & baggage collection has stopped working‚Ä¶ KLIA has millions of travellers paying airport taxes and still they haven‚Äôt fixed! Also look at my suitcase how it‚Äôs getting thrown. Video from about 30 mins back!!!

Nice place big and spacious.  Parking is a bit confusing so always park at Preferred parking to avoid looking for a car.
Long walk to the bus upon arrival as the train is not ready.  Directions to the bus are not clear.
Getting out of customs is always so packed as all have to go through another luggage scanning.  Long queues to just get out of the airport.
Not very friendly to the visitors as this is the point of arrival and bad first impression.
Extremely slow employees at the AirAsia counter; no one seems to have a clue. They send you around the area, and on top of that, they weren't exactly friendly or helpful... a real shame.
If there is a batik water counter near Klia, which area is it?
Very inconvenient airport, everything is very far away
A chaotic airport, there are many shops and it is modern but everything related to entering or leaving is a hassle, poor signage and poor communication, a lot of time is wasted

One of the worst airports I have ever been in. Immigration is more interested in chitchat between themselves with laughing and jokes rather than doing a solid job, yet you are easy to get attitude from them. Takes solid 1:30 hour‚Äôs to pass without security check, taking bus to different terminal means waiting in lines again for the bus and all of that for you to get in another line for security check right at the gate. After that you are locked in a glass box without a toilet, store or chance to even have bottle of water. Thank you, great experience.

I had the worst experience in this airport for travelling.  This looks fancy but very old school.
Restaurant not enough air con at night time. Sweating when eating

Very confusing direction or procedure. I was required to transferred here from overseas to KKIA (domestic) i was not required to take my lugguage while I gone through the customs here. Somehow disappointed with the airport.

I‚Äôve traveled through KLIA countless times over the years, and it has always stood out for its cleanliness, smooth check-in process, and efficient security checks. The architecture, inspired by Malaysian, Islamic, and natural elements, is a beautiful highlight. But what truly made KLIA special was its balance of foreign and unique local offerings.

With the recent KLIA1 renovation, I have to give credit where it‚Äôs due- the new bathrooms are a massive improvement! Well-designed, clean, and dry. But I can‚Äôt ignore the disappointing shift in retail and dining options. Many local options have disappeared, replaced by foreign goods. Also why is alcohol and tobacco taking up a large portion of the retail space every time? I was shocked to find only one shelf of Malaysian food products in the entire terminal 1. Malaysia is a foodie haven‚Äîwhy isn‚Äôt KLIA showcasing its rich culinary heritage and diversity? This seem to now be engulfed by the blandness of foreign cafe franchises, croissants and cakes. Would be delightful to have more local options!

Gone are the great local options that once served authentic dishes like kaya toast, prawn noodles and teh tarik. Instead, global chains like Starbucks and Gloria Jean‚Äôs dominate the F&B spaces. Surely, there‚Äôs room for more homegrown eateries that represent Malaysia‚Äôs incredible food culture?

To add to the frustration, the monorail is still not working, and travelers have to rely on shuttle buses- slow and less efficient. And when I asked an ‚ÄòAsk Me For Help‚Äô staff member for food recommendations, she barely looked up from her phone‚Äîcustomer service should be better than this.

KLIA, we can do better! Support local businesses and bring back the true Malaysian experience.
